title: why can't i get ttx to work?
content:
running Win XP SP2. i downloaded and installed TTX, but i can’t get it to work. i drag my otf onto the icon and i just get a back “not” symbol and no resulting xml file. i know it’s worked for me in the past... is there a setting somewhere i need to toggle? please help.  
actually... it looks like none of my drag and drop behaviors are working. i just tried doing the same thing with a .jpg to my photoshop icon and got the same “not” symbol. what to do?

 [‹ Tiger kills AAT!](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811130937/http:/typophile.com/node/12198 "Go to previous forum topic") [How do I count glyphs in FontLab? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811130937/http:/typophile.com/node/17522 "Go to next forum topic")
author: paul d hunt

comments.content: Try opening a command console using ’cmd’ from the Start/Run menu. Then try running TTX from the command prompt. If this works, the problem is definitely related to drag and drop. Have you tried rebooting?

it was drag & drop. it had stopped working for some reason, but i found these instructions on the web:  
 [http://windowsxp.mvps.org/dropbat.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811130937/http:/windowsxp.mvps.org/dropbat.htm "http://windowsxp.mvps.org/dropbat.htm")  
and then just substituted “bat” by “exe” and now it’s all good. thanx for the help, john!

Paul,

are you using the Windows build that I maintain ( [http://www.font.org/software/ttx/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811130937/http:/www.font.org/software/ttx/ "http://www.font.org/software/ttx/") ) or some other?

A.

i’m pretty sure it’s the one you maintain, adam, but not totally sure. the problem was a windows problem though, and not with the tools. everything is working properly now that i restored drag/drop functioning to windows.
